story:
Soomin's Sunny Day Adventure

Soomin loved playing outside on sunny days. One morning, Soomin decided to go on a special adventure to find the most beautiful flowers in the garden.

As Soomin walked through the green grass, they saw big trees with tall branches and lots of leaves. "Wow! Look at all those big leaves!" said Soomin.

Soomin wanted to see the flowers up close, so they climbed over small rocks and under a long bridge. When they got to the other side, Soomin found some soft, yellow petals. "Yellow is a happy color!" exclaimed Soomin.

But then, Soomin saw some muddy puddles. "Oh no! I don't want to get dirty feet!" said Soomin. Just then, their friend, a kind rabbit named Rosie, appeared. "Don't worry, Soomin! We can walk around the puddles together."

Rosie and Soomin walked hand in hand until they reached a beautiful garden filled with many colorful flowers – red roses, bluebells, and yellow daisies. Soomin was so happy to see all these pretty flowers!

As they picked some of the flowers to take home, Soomin counted them out loud: "One, two, three, four... lots of flowers!" Rosie smiled and said, "Yes, you found many beautiful flowers!"

Soomin was thrilled with their adventure. They learned that sometimes it's okay to ask for help, and that they could find many wonderful things when they worked together with friends.

This story supports early language development by:
* Using descriptive words like "big," "tall," "soft," "happy," and "pretty"
* Practicing plural forms like "leaves" and "flowers"
* Understanding spatial concepts like "over," "under," and "around"

I hope Soomin and you enjoy this story!
